Name: Ray's Hard Lemonade
Ingredients: 45 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix)
Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water
Instructions: Lightly MUDDLE (just to bruise) mint in base of shaker. Add next four ingredients, SHAKE with ice and fine strain into ice-filled glass. TOP with soda, lightly stir and serve with straws.
Review: Alcoholic lemonade with mint? A vodka mojito? However you describe it, it works.
History: Discovered in 2004 at Spring Street Natural Restaurant, New York City, USA.
